Title: Horde Application Framework: Remote code execution
Synopsis:
The help viewer of the Horde Framework allows attackers to execute
    arbitrary remote code.

Background.Text: The Horde Application Framework is a general-purpose web application framework written in PHP, providing classes for handling preferences, compression, browser detection, connection tracking, MIME and more.

Description.Text: Jan Schneider of the Horde team discovered a vulnerability in the help viewer of the Horde Application Framework that could allow remote code execution (CVE-2006-1491). Paul Craig reported that "services/go.php" fails to validate the passed URL parameter correctly (CVE-2006-1260).

Impact.Text: An attacker could exploit the vulnerability in the help viewer to execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the web server user. By embedding a NULL character in the URL parameter, an attacker could exploit the input validation issue in go.php to read arbitrary files.

Workaround.Text: There are no known workarounds at this time.

P.Text:
All Horde Application Framework users should upgrade to the latest
    version:
